meanings.definition: A person who girdles or encircles something.
meanings.sent1: The girdlers carefully wrapped the ribbon around the gift.
meanings.sent2: The group of girdlers circled the tree to measure its circumference.
meanings.sent3: The girdlers decided to play a game where they had to encircle each other without touching.
meanings.sent4: In the ancient legend, the girdlers were said to protect the sacred land by forming a protective ring around it.
meanings.sent5: The image of the girdlers holding hands around the campfire stayed with me as a symbol of unity.

meanings.definition: Plural form of girdler, referring to multiple individuals who girdle or encircle something.
meanings.sent1: We saw a group of girdlers surrounding the old oak tree.
meanings.sent2: The girdlers in the forest were busy marking the trees for removal.
meanings.sent3: The girdlers at the party formed a human chain to pass the snacks around.
meanings.sent4: The girdlers in the story were like a protective barrier against any harm that might come their way.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the girdlers linking arms to form a circle was both impressive and heartwarming.
